summary: This document consists of two emails from attorney Marc Fernich to an unspecified recipient (likely the court or opposing counsel) regarding a delay in filing and serving Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure. The emails indicate logistical issues, including the client not being produced for review earlier that morning.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: Attorney sending emails regarding a delay in filing and serving Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure, indicating he represents the client (Epstein).

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) in the second email, suggesting involvement in the legal matter.

connections.description: Fernich is handling the filing of Epstein's financial disclosure, indicating he is acting as Epstein's attorney.

events.title: Delay in Epstein Financial Disclosure Filing
events.description: Attorney Marc Fernich emails to apologize for a slight delay in filing and serving Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure, citing the client not being produced for review earlier that morning.

locations: 810 Seventh Ave. Ste. 620 New York, NY 10019
keyFacts: Attorney Marc Fernich was handling Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure filing in July 2019.
There was a logistical delay in filing because the client (Epstein) was not produced for visitation, review, and approval earlier on July 12, 2019.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings requiring financial disclosure from Epstein around the time of his arrest.
